titles.en: THE BOOK OF BELIEF (Emān) AND DISBELIEF (KUFR)

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ الْكُوفِيِّ عَنْ عُبَيْسِ بْنِ هِشَامٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ الْمِنْقَرِيِّ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ ظَبْيَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لَكُمْ لَنُوراً تُعْرَفُونَ بِهِ فِي الدُّنْيَا حَتَّى إِنَّ أَحَدَكُمْ إِذَا لَقِيَ أَخَاهُ قَبَّلَهُ فِي مَوْضِعِ النُّورِ مِنْ جَبْهَتِهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Al Hassan Bin Ali Al Kufy, from Ubeys Bin Hisham, from Al Husayn Bin Ahmad Al Minqary, from Yunus Bin Zabyan, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For you all (Shia) there is a light you are being recognised with in the world, to the extent that one of you, when he meets his brother, kisses him in the place of the light from his forehead’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رِفَاعَةَ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا يُقَبَّلُ رَأْسُ أَحَدٍ وَ لَا يَدُهُ إِلَّا يَدُ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) أَوْ مَنْ أُرِيدَ بِهِ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Rifa’at Bin Musa, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Do not kiss the head (forehead) of anyone, nor his hand, except for the hand of Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup>, or the one who intends Rasool-Allah<sup>azwj</sup> by it’.

verses.text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ زَيْدٍ النَّرْسِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مَزْيَدٍ صَاحِبِ السَّابِرِيِّ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَتَنَاوَلْتُ يَدَهُ فَقَبَّلْتُهَا فَقَالَ أَمَا إِنَّهَا لَا تَصْلُحُ إِلَّا لِنَبِيٍّ أَوْ وَصِيِّ نَبِيٍّ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Zayd Al Narsy, from Ali Bin Mazeyd a companion of Al Sabiri who said, 
‘I went over to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, and I took his<sup>asws</sup> hand and I kissed it. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘But it is not correct except for a Prophet<sup>azwj</sup> or a successor<sup>asws</sup> of a Prophet<sup>saww</sup>’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الْحَجَّالِ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ يَعْقُوبَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) نَاوِلْنِي يَدَكَ أُقَبِّلْهَا فَأَعْطَانِيهَا فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ رَأْسَكَ فَفَعَلَ فَقَبَّلْتُهُ فَقُلْتُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ رِجْلَاكَ فَقَالَ أَقْسَمْتُ أَقْسَمْتُ أَقْسَمْتُ ثَلَاثاً وَ بَقِيَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ بَقِيَ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ بَقِيَ شَيْ‏ءٌ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Al Hajjal, from Yunus bin Yaqoub who said, 
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Give me your<sup>asws</sup> hand, so I can kiss it’. So he<sup>asws</sup> gave it to me. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! Your<sup>asws</sup> (fore) head (as well)’. So he<sup>asws</sup> did. So I said, ‘May I be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>! Your<sup>asws</sup> leg (as well)’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘You oathed, you oathed you oathed’, three times; ‘And there remains something, there remains something, there remains something’.

verses.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ قَبَّلَ لِلرَّحِمِ ذَا قَرَابَةٍ فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ شَيْ‏ءٌ وَ قُبْلَةُ الْأَخِ عَلَى الْخَدِّ وَ قُبْلَةُ الْإِمَامِ بَيْنَ عَيْنَيْهِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Muhammad Bin Yahya, from al Amraky Bin Ali, 
(It has been narrated) from Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who kisses for the relationship of the one with relationship, so there is nothing upon him, and kisses the brother upon the cheek, and kisses the Imam<sup>asws</sup> between his<sup>asws</sup> eyes’.

verses.text: وَ عَنْهُ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سِنَانٍ عَنْ أَبِي الصَّبَّاحِ مَوْلَى آلِ سَامٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَيْسَ الْقُبْلَةُ عَلَى الْفَمِ إِلَّا لِلزَّوْجَةِ أَوِ الْوَلَدِ الصَّغِيرِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
And from him, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Muhammad Bin Sinan, from Abu Al Sabbah, a slave of the family of Saam, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is (to be) no kissing upon the mouth except for the wife, or a young child’.
